patterns: What courses are in the program?
Which classes would we have to take?
responses: We have classes in statistics, programming, and linear algebra
Course topics include Python coding, math, and statistics
Check out our classes in the course catalog.

patterns: What knowledge is necessary to join the program?
Do I need to have a background in statistics?
Do I need to have coding experience?
Do I need to know SQL?
Do I have to know how to code?
What are the key background requirements?
responses: A background in statistics, linear algebra, and Python programming is required
Applicants must have high grades in prior coursework in probability and statistics, linear algebra, and computer programming
Typically, though not always, our applicants have studied mathematics, engineering, economics, statistics, or computer science

patterns: What is the length of the program?
How many months long is the Master's program?
When does the program take place?
responses: MSDS is a 12-month accelerated Master's program that starts and ends in July
A 1 year program starting in July

patterns: What companies do students intern at?
How much time do people spend at their internships?
What companies do students work with for practicum?
Do students need to find their own practicum companies?
Do students typically get paid by their practicum companies?
How much time do students spend on practicum?
responses: Students work with companies from all industries like Airbnb, Reddit, United Healthcare, and UCSF for 15 hours a week, with the decision to provide compensation for practicum work is up to each company
Practicums cover numerous industries and mandate 15 hours per week of work. Pay is up to the discretion of the company

Each year, roughly 60 companies come to pitch their projects/practicum to our students during “Pitch Day” and each student chooses their top 15 projects and companies (past and current partners include those shown below). See here.
Practicum is unique to MSDS and allows students to get hands on expierience in both paid and unpaid internships. For more information, see here.

patterns: What is the total cost of the program?
What is the cost per semester?
responses: The total cost of the 35-unit program was $51,800 in 2020-2021. We offer a limited number of scholarships. Please see our Financing Your Education page for more information on financing options
The $50,000+ cost of the program has many financing options. Visit our Financing your Education page for more information

patterns: Tell me more about the professors?
responses: We have many wonderful professors with diverse backgrounds. Please see this link for more details on our faculty.

patterns: Tell me more about the current cohort
What schools did the current students attend?
What kind of students are in the program?
What types of student come to the program?
What is the background of current students?
responses: We have a diverse set of students from many backgrounds ranging from computer science to psychology! Our current cohort is 60% male and 40% female. For a more robust class profile, see the class profile or the meet the students page.
